classFeature.name: Monstie Proficiencies Improvement
entries: {@i 19th-level Monstie Sidekick feature}

At 1st level, choose up to 2 skills the base stat block has, the monstie now has those skills. If the original monster has more than two skills your monstie gains another skill at 4th, 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level (or until the monstie knows all the skills the original monster does).

classFeature.name: Ability score improvement
entries: {@i 19th-level Monstie Sidekick feature}

At 4th level and again at 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, the monstie increases one ability score of your choice by 2, or the sidekick increases two ability scores of your choice by 1. The monstie can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Monstie Trait Improvement
entries: {@i 20th-level Monstie Sidekick feature}

Beginning at 2nd level your monstie natural instincts are heightened. Choose one nondamage dealing trait, except legendary resistance or magic resistance, the original monster has. Your monstie gains that trait. Your monstie gains another trait from the original monster at 10th and 20th level.
If the trait your monstie learns provides bonuses to a skill(s) or AC, the bonus is equal to the monstie's PB.

If the original monster only has traits that deal damage or your monstie knows all the original monster's traits, then your monstie increase one ability score of your choice by 1. The monstie can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

items: As a bonus action, you can attach or detach a {@item shield|PHB} to your {@item heavy bowgun|AGMH}.
While the shield is attached, you gain a +2 bonus to your AC, your movement speed is halved, and being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
When you attack a creature with your heavy bowgun, and they are within the weapon's normal range, you can choose to use Strength instead of Dexterity for its attack and damage bonuses.
You are proficient with improvised thrown weapons.
You gain proficiency with {@item tinker's tools|PHB}. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with them.
You can detonate {@filter barrel bombs|items|source=AGMH|search=barrel-bomb} planted by you, as a bonus action, from up to 60 feet away with the snap of your fingers.

feat.name: Frenzy Fever
entries: Research once again goes a step too far with the invention of a medicine that will give you the frenzy virus.

items: You are infected with a mutated version of the {@condition frenzy virus|MHMM}. You gain all the effects of the frenzy virus sentient race template on page 80 of the Monster Hunter Monster Manual except for the impaired healing effect. You can still heal from nonmagical means.

At your DM's discretion, whenever you hit a creature with your natural weapon attacks (claws or bite mainly), they can have the creature make a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. On a failed save the creature is infected with the frenzy virus (See page 80 of the Monster Hunter Monster Manual). On a successful save, the target is immune to your mutated version of the frenzy virus, forever.

entries: {@b Creator's Note}
Dungeon Masters, don't allow your players to intentionally infect other players' characters. This could be a great story and mechanical feat, but could potentially ruin a campaign if you let it.

feat.name: Gunlance Mastery
entries: You have unlocked the secrets of the {@item gunlance|AGMH}. While you are attuned to a gunlance, its {@optfeature wyvernfire|AGMH} now recharges on a short or long rest. Additionally, it uses a new type of shell. Choose one of the following shells below that you now use in place of your original {@optfeature shells|AGMH}:

items.name: Long Range Shells
entries: Your shell's attack range is now 150/600 feet.

items.name: Wide Range Shells
entries: When you hit a creature with your shell attack, you also deal your damage against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of your weapon.

items.name: Short Range Shells
entries: The attack range of your shells is reduced by half, but you can add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage.

feat.name: Horn Maestro
entries: Thanks to extensive practice with the {@item hunting horn|AGMH}, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your hunting horn's chord length is increased by 1.
You can now complete a hunting horn's melody as a bonus action.
{@i Fortissimo!} Your hunting horn's single note melody effect is doubled.

feat.name: Insect Glaive Mastery
entries: You master fighting with an {@item insect glaive|AGMH}, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you use the insect glaive standing leap property, you can now use the Attack action as part of the same action, instead of a single weapon attack. Additionally, if you use the standing leap property to jump into the air, the distance you can jump is doubled.

When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack from your insect glaive, while you are in the air, you can move up to 10 feet in any direction. This movement does not count against your normal movement speed or the amount of movement you gain from the standing leap property.
When you are wielding a {@item Hammer|AGMH}, you can use its hammer {@optfeature charge (H)|AGMH} property when you move 15 feet instead of 20.
If you jump when performing a hammer charge, you perform a spinning hammer charge that allows you to pass through a hostile creatures space without provoking opportunity attacks.

You can add the extra damage from the hammer charge to 1 additional attack on this turn for every 5 feet you jump during the charge, so long as the attacks target a creature you passed through during the spinning hammer charge.

feat.name: Kinsect Mastery
entries: You can use an action to have your {@item insect glaive|AGMH|kinsect} act as if it was summoned by the {@spell find familiar} spell, with the following differences:

items: It can only be used in this way for a total of 1 hour each day.
It cannot be dismissed, instead you can use an action to call it back to you.
It uses the stat block of a {@creature hawk} (MM p.330).
When its hit points reaches 0 it reappears on your insect glaive at full hit points and will resume what it was last doing unless told otherwise.
It can use its action to absorb a creature's essence in the standard order, but it can return this essence to you or one other creature you designate as an action.
While being used in this way, you cannot use it to attack as part of your Attack action.
You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice that is listed in the combo list section of chapter 3.
Whenever you attempt to craft anything from the combo list, the DC to craft it is reduced by the number of times this feat has been taken by you.
You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different tool.

entries.name: Applicable Tools
items: {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}
{@item brewer's supplies|PHB}
{@item cook's utensils|PHB}
{@item glassblower's tools|PHB}
{@item herbalism kit|PHB}
{@item poisoner's kit|PHB}
{@item smith's tools|PHB}
{@item tinker's tools|PHB}
{@item woodcarver's tools|PHB}
You have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks to {@action climb onto a bigger creature|DMG} (DMG p.271) or remain on a creature you are already on.

While you remain on a bigger creature, you can use your action to make an unarmed strike against the creature. On a hit, the creature must use its reaction to move up to half its movement speed in a direction of your choice. If it hits a solid object - that is as big or larger than it - before the end of its movement, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}. If the creature would enter into any environmental hazard dangerous to the creature (such as falling off a cliff when it can't fly, or into lava when it isn't immune to fire), it instead falls prone in the space adjacent to the hazard.

feat.name: Switchaxe Mastery
entries: You master fighting with the {@item switch axe|AGMH|switchaxe}, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you use a phial and critically hit with this weapon, you regain a number of expended {@optfeature phials|AGMH} equal to half the cost of the one you used (rounded up).
Your phials save DC is increased by 1.
You can use a free action on your turn to {@optfeature switch mode (sa)|AGMH|switch weapon modes}. This replaces your free action to draw or stow a weapon.

feat.name: Additional Wildshapes
entries: Choose a creature type: {@filter Bird Wyverns|bestiary|source=MHMM|challenge rating=[&0;&6]|search=Wyvern|tag=bird}, {@filter Brute Wyverns|bestiary|source=MHMM|challenge rating=[&0;&6]|search=Wyvern|tag=brute}, {@filter Fanged Wyverns|bestiary|source=MHMM|challenge rating=[&0;&6]|search=Wyvern|tag=fanged}, {@filter Flying Wyverns|bestiary|source=MHMM|challenge rating=[&0;&6]|search=Wyvern|tag=flying}, {@filter Leviathans|bestiary|source=MHMM|challenge rating=[&0;&6]|search=leviathan}, {@filter Neopterons & Temnoceran|bestiary|source=MHMM|challenge rating=[&0;&6]|tag=neopteron;temnoceran}, {@filter Piscine Wyverns|bestiary|source=MHMM|challenge rating=[&0;&6]|search=wyvern|tag=piscine}.

You can use your Wild Shape to transform into a creature from the type you chose (you ignore the fact that the creature isn't a beast, but must abide by the other wildshape limitations for your level). Additionally when you wildshape into one of these creatures, you cannot use their legendary resistances (if it has any), any recharge ability can only be used once per wildshape, and you cannot use any action or ability that can only be used a limited number of times a day/rest.
You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different creature type.
{@b Creator's Note}

The Additional Wildshape feat is still in the testing phases. Allowing the recharge ability to be used once, keeps the creatures CR more accurate to its calculated CR. This might be removed after some testing, but for the time being it should be ok, but your DM may use their own discretion to limit use of recharge abilities.

item.name: Accel Axe
entries: The Accel Axe, also known as the "Axel Axe", it is completely different from the Switch Axe and Charge Blade that were discovered in other ancient ruins. The main feature of the Accel Axe is the artillery mechanism built into the weapon. A heavy-duty single-edged axe with a short reach and a mechanical muzzle attached at the opposite position to the blade.

rows: {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH}, {@optfeature Detonation Velocity|AGMH}, {@optfeature Accel Jump|AGMH}, {@optfeature Burst Slash|AGMH}
{@optfeature Heat Gauge|AGMH}, {@optfeature Full Accel Mode|AGMH}, {@optfeature Blast Evade|AGMH}
{@optfeature Hyper Burst Slash|AGMH}, {@optfeature Mid-Air Dash Slash|AGMH|Mid-Air Dash Slash (2/turn)}

entries: {@b {@i Burst Slash Dice.}} As an uncommon accel axe's rarity increases, its {@optfeature Burst Slash|AGMH} feature increases in die size.

item.name: Charge Blade
entries: {@i Sword mode boasts mobility and high guard capabilities, while axe mode boasts more powerful attacks. Store up energy while in sword mode, and then use it to deal high damage in axe mode.}

rows: {@optfeature Elemental Discharge|AGMH|Elemental Discharge (Axe)}, {@optfeature Amped Element Discharge|AGMH}
{@optfeature Elemental Guard Upgrade|AGMH}, {@optfeature Elemental Discharge Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Amped Element Discharge Upgrade I|AGMH}
{@optfeature Elemental Discharge Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Amped Element Discharge Upgrade II|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i AC Bonus.}} A rare charge blade grants a bonus to AC while the shield is equipped. As its rarity increases, its AC bonus also increases.

item.name: Dual Blades
entries: {@i Dual blades unleash a whirlwind of combo attacks on your enemy. Though they're lightweight and relatively simple to use, they cannot be used to guard.}
Listed costs and weights account for a complete set of 2 dual blades.

rows: {@optfeature Archdemon Mode|AGMH|Archdemon Mode (Demon Mode Upgrade)}, {@optfeature Inflict Upgrade I|AGMH}
{@optfeature Archdemon Mode Upgrade|AGMH}, {@optfeature Inflict Upgrade II|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i Demon Modes.}} As an uncommon set of dual blades' rarity increases, it grants more uses of {@optfeature demon mode|AGMH}.

item.name: Great Sword
entries: {@i A slow, heavy weapon with massive damage potential, the Greatsword is the heavy artillery of melee weapons. While simple at first, the Greatsword requires skilled timing and spacing in order to get the most out of it. On offense, the Greatsword attacks with slow, ponderous swings that hit with precision and accuracy.}

rows: {@optfeature Charged Slash Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Guard Upgrade I (GS)|AGMH|Guard Upgrade I}
{@optfeature Charged Slash Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Guard Upgrade II (GS)|AGMH|Guard Upgrade II}

item.name: Gunlance
entries: {@i The gunlance offers more offensive power than the lance thanks to the addition of shelling attacks, and it also has good guarding capabilities. It may take time to master.}
Listed costs and weights account for a complete set of gunlance and shield.

rows: {@optfeature Guard Reload|AGMH}, {@optfeature Shells Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Wyvernfire|AGMH}
{@optfeature Blast Dash|AGMH}, {@optfeature Charged Shelling|AGMH}, {@optfeature Shells Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Wyvernfire Upgrade I|AGMH}
{@optfeature Charge Shelling Upgrade|AGMH}, {@optfeature Shells Upgrade III|AGMH}, {@optfeature Wyvernfire Upgrade II|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i AC Bonus.}} A rare gunlance grants a bonus to AC while the shield is equipped. As its rarity increases, its AC bonus also increases.

item.name: Hammer
entries: {@i The hammer is a powerful blunt weapon with a surprising amount of mobility. It's also possible to stun monsters by delivering a hammer attack to the head.}

rows: {@optfeature Mighty Weapon Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Charge Upgrade I (H)|AGMH|Charge Upgrade I}
{@optfeature Mighty Weapon Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Charge Upgrade II (H)|AGMH|Charge Upgrade II}
{@optfeature Mighty Weapon Upgrade III|AGMH}, {@optfeature Charge Upgrade III (H)|AGMH|Charge Upgrade III}

item.name: Hunting Horn
entries: {@i The hunting horn is a blunt weapon that can bestow positive status effects on yourself and your allies. Use it to perform melodies that can boost attack power and grant other beneficial effects.}

entries.name: Hunting Horn
entries: Unlike other melee hunter weapons, hunting horns begin with two features, {@optfeature Melody|AGMH} and {@optfeature Single Note Melody|AGMH}, and do not gain any more as their rarity increases. Instead, they gain access to new {@b {@i Notes}} which can be used in conjunction with these features.
{@b {@i Chord Length.}} As a hunting horn's rarity increases, it gains the ability to perform more notes at a time in a single {@optfeature melody|AGMH}.
{@b {@i Notes.}} As a hunting horn's rarity increases, it gains access to more notes. Rarer horns have access to notes from all lower rarities.

entries.name: Variant: Notes
entries: Not all notes are immediately available upon obtaining the various hunting horns. Instead notes can be obtained in the following ways:

items: Sold by a Vendor.
Obtained as treasure.
Quest reward.
Crafted by the character using {@item weaver's tools|PHB}.

entries: These Notes can come in the form of arcane runes, vibrating strings, or other objects. Once the character obtains a note, they can add/install it to their hunting horn during a long rest.

item.name: Insect Glaive
entries: {@i The insect glaive can be used to control a Kinsect, a small insect that harvests extracts from monsters to boost your abilities.}

item.name: Lance
entries: {@i The lance is better at guarding than most weapons. In addition to its long reach, its thrust attacks can be executed with little exposure to enemy attacks. Great for defense-oriented combat.}
Listed costs and weights account for a complete set of lance and shield.

rows: {@optfeature Charge Upgrade I (L)|AGMH|Charge Upgrade I}, {@optfeature Powerguard Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Counter Thrust|AGMH}
{@optfeature Charge Upgrade II (L)|AGMH|Charge Upgrade II}, {@optfeature Powerguard Upgrade II|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i AC Bonus.}} A rare lance grants a bonus to AC while the shield is equipped. As its rarity increases, its AC bonus also increases.

item.name: Longsword
entries: {@i An elegant weapon, the Long Sword is a well rounded offensive weapon. On top of its solid base moveset, it has a unique Spirit Gauge system. Every non-Spirit attack from the Long Sword charges up a Spirit Gauge that increases attack damage and unlocks Spirit Blade attacks.}

rows: {@optfeature Spirit Gauge Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Foresight Slash|AGMH}
{@optfeature Spirit Gauge Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Spirit Thrust|AGMH}, {@optfeature Spirit Roundslash|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i Spirit Gain.}} As an uncommon long sword's rarity increases, it gains more {@optfeature Spirit Gauge|AGMH|spirit charges} when used to hit a target.

item.name: Magnet Spike
entries: {@i This weapon is a heavy, melee type weapon with the ability to switch between two different weapon modes: A Slashing mode and an Impact mode. The key aspect of the weapon is its magnetism abilities. Naturally being a large, heavy weapon, it would be difficult to even handle or use in combat, but by manipulating the magnetic force in the weapon most of the weight is lifted, it becomes possible to move so fast that it would otherwise be deemed unnatural.}

rows: {@optfeature Switch Mode (MS)|AGMH|Switch Mode}, {@optfeature Magnetic Field Gun|AGMH}, {@optfeature Magnetic Boost|AGMH}
{@optfeature Magnetic Field Assault Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Magnetic Force Evade Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Magnetic Bind|AGMH}
{@optfeature Magnetic Field Assault Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Magnetic Force Evade Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Magnetic Bind Upgrade|AGMH}

item.name: Magus Staff
entries: {@i Used more for walking than striking a creature, the magus staves are finely crafted. Inlaid with gems and intricate carvings allowing the casting and storing of spells within them, the Magus Staff are the choice weapon for a spellcaster.}

rows: {@optfeature Defense Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Spell Storing Upgrade II|AGMH}
{@optfeature Defense Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Spell Storing Upgrade III|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i AC Bonus.}} A rare magus staff grants a bonus to AC. As its rarity increases, its AC bonus also increases.
{@b {@i Spell Storing.}} An uncommon magus staff can store spells. As its rarity increases, the number of levels worth of spells it can store also increases.

item.name: Splint Rapier
entries: {@i As a single rapier, it supports the party. As splint rapiers, it debuffs the enemy.}

rows: {@optfeature New Splint Stance|AGMH}, {@optfeature Elemental Stance Upgrade|AGMH}
{@optfeature Stymie Stance Upgrade|AGMH}, {@optfeature Saboteur Stance Upgrade|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i Single / Splint Features.}} An uncommon splint rapier has different features available for use while in each of its two modes. As its rarity increases it gains more such mode-specific features.

item.name: Switch Axe
entries: {@i The switch Axe morphs between axe and sword modes. Axe mode boasts long reach, while sword mode features explosive finishers.}

rows: {@optfeature Sword Gauge Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Power Phial Upgrade|AGMH}
{@optfeature Sword Gauge Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Phials Upgrade|AGMH}, {@optfeature Element Phial Upgrade|AGMH}, {@optfeature Poison Phial Upgrade|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i Phials.}} As an uncommon switch axe's rarity increases, it gains access to more types of {@filter phials|items|source=AGMH|type=phial (switch axe)}. Rarer switch axes have access to phials from all lower rarities.

item.name: Sword and Shield
entries: {@i Lightweight and easy to use, the sword & shield also boasts outstanding attack speed. The shield can be used to guard, though it may not hold up to certain attacks.}
Listed costs and weights account for a complete set of sword and shield.
{@b {@i AC Bonus.}} A rare sword and shield grants a bonus to AC while the shield is equipped. As its rarity increases, its AC bonus also increases.

item.name: Tonfas
entries: {@i The Tonfa is made up of two light, swift poles with a propulsion system. Due to this, hunters can easily evade while the weapon is drawn and even propel themselves from the ground.}
Listed costs and weights account for a complete set of 2 tonfas.

rows: {@optfeature Dragon Spirit Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Propel Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Air Dash|AGMH}, {@optfeature Dragon Spirit Piercing Attack|AGMH}
{@optfeature Dragon Spirit Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Propel Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Air Dash Upgrade|AGMH}, {@optfeature Dragon Spirit Piercing Attack Upgrade I|AGMH}
{@optfeature Dragon Spirit Upgrade III|AGMH}, {@optfeature Propel Upgrade III|AGMH}, {@optfeature Dragon Spirit Piercing Attack Upgrade II|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i AC Bonus.}} A rare set of tonfas grants a bonus to AC while wielding both tonfas. As its rarity increases, its AC bonus also increases.
{@b {@i Maximum Spirit.}} An uncommon set of tonfas can gain {@optfeature dragon spirit|AGMH} up to a certain limit. This limit increases as its rarity increases.

item.name: Wyvern Boomerang
entries: {@i Its a giant fucking boomerang you need power gauntlets to wield.}

rows: {@optfeature Silkbind Strike|AGMH}, {@optfeature Power Gauntlets Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Ricochet Upgrade I|AGMH}, {@optfeature Running Start Upgrade I|AGMH}
{@optfeature Silkbind Redirect|AGMH}, {@optfeature Power Gauntlets Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Ricochet Upgrade II|AGMH}, {@optfeature Running Start Upgrade II|AGMH}
{@optfeature Ricochet Upgrade III|AGMH}, {@optfeature Running Start Upgrade III|AGMH}, {@optfeature Silkbind Strike Upgrade|AGMH}

entries: {@b {@i Possible Range.}} An uncommon wyvern boomerang's normal and maximum range can be increased temporarily. As its rarity increases, its ranges can be increased further still.

item.name: Bow
entries: {@i The bow is a mid-range weapon that can perform a variety of attacks. While simple to use, its mastery requires a detailed knowledge of the best combinations of arrows and {@filter coatings|items|source=AGMH|type=coating (bow)}.}
{@b {@i Coatings.}} As a bow's rarity increases, it gains access to more types of {@filter coatings|items|source=AGMH|type=coating (bow)}. Rarer bows have access to coatings from all lower rarities.

item.name: Dual Repeaters
entries: A fully-ranged option for the fleet of foot. Dance the line between close and long range as you dish out damage, buffs, and traps. There is a fair amount of damage falloff as you move farther away from behemoths. The closer you are, the more damage you do.
Listed costs and weights account for a complete set of 2 dual repeaters.

{@b {@i Available.}} As a set of dual repeaters' rarity increases, it gains access to more types of {@filter ammo|items|source=AGMH|type=ammo (repeaters)}. A very rare set of repeaters also gains access to possible {@optfeature modifications|AGMH}. Rarer repeaters have access to ammo and modifications from all lower rarities.

item.name: Heavy Bowgun
entries: {@i The Heavy Bowgun is the artillery of ranged weapons. It specializes in high damage rounds at a range. While it does not have the same special effects of the Light Bowgun, the Heavy Bowgun dishes out damage more reliably.}

entries.name: Heavy Bowgun
entries: Heavy Bowguns begin with the {@optfeature Ammo (HBG)|AGMH|Ammo} feature, and do not gain any more as their rarity increases. Instead, they gain access to new types of {@b {@i Ammo}}.
{@b {@i Ammo.}} As a heavy bowgun's rarity increases, it gains access to more types of ammo. Rarer bowguns have access to ammo from all lower rarities.

item.name: Light Bowgun
entries: {@i The Light Bowgun is the smallest ranged weapon. It boasts the highest fire rate of the ranged weapons. It also specializes in supporting ammo, such as poison, paralysis and recovery, meaning it can reliably inflict a variety of status effects on the monster while still dealing damage.}

entries.name: Light Bowgun
entries: Light Bowguns begin with the {@optfeature Rapid Fire|AGMH}, {@optfeature Overheat|AGMH}, and {@optfeature Ammo (HBG)|AGMH|Ammo} features, and do not gain any more as their rarity increases. Instead, they gain access to new types of {@b {@i Ammo}}.
{@b {@i Ammo.}} As a light bowgun's rarity increases, it gains access to more types of ammo. Rarer bowguns have access to ammo from all lower rarities.

rows: This weapon's damage die increases to a {@damage d12} for this attack
You deal an extra {@damage 1d4} acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice) on this attack.
The target must also succeed on a a Constitution saving throw against a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a successful save. A creature that succeeds its save against this phial is immune to its effect for 24 hours.
You deal an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage on this attack.

The target must succeed a Constitution saving throw against a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on checks made with one ability score of your choice for 1 minute.

item.name: Power Coating
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls.
This coating can only be used with a bow of {@item bow (u)|AGMH|uncommon} or higher rarity.

item.name: Close Range Coating
entries: You ignore all disadvantages when attacking a creature, you can see, that are within 15 feet of you. You have disadvantage on attacks against creatures that are more than 15 feet from you.
This coating can only be used with a bow of {@item bow (r)|AGMH|rare} or higher rarity.

item.name: Poison Coating
entries: A creature struck by this arrow must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.
This coating can only be used with a bow of {@item bow (r)|AGMH|rare} or higher rarity.

item.name: Power Coating +2
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls.
This coating can only be used with a bow of {@item bow (r)|AGMH|rare} or higher rarity.

item.name: Paralysis Coating
entries: A creature struck by this arrow must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a successful save. A creature that succeeds a save against this coating is immune to its effect for 24 hours.
This coating can only be used with a bow of {@item bow (vr)|AGMH|very rare} or higher rarity.

item.name: Power Coating +3
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls.
This coating can only be used with a bow of {@item bow (vr)|AGMH|very rare} or higher rarity.

item.name: Sleep Coating
entries: A creature struck by this coating must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} for 1d4 rounds. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, they instead fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, until the creature takes damage, or is shaken awake as an action.
This coating can only be used with a bow of {@item bow (vr)|AGMH|very rare} or higher rarity.

item.name: Blast Coating
entries: A creature struck by this coating takes an additional 1d6 fire damage and each creature in a 5-foot radius of the creature takes half as much fire damage.
This coating can only be used with a bow of {@item bow (l)|AGMH|legendary} rarity.

rows: Acts as a {@item tranq bomb|AGMH} with the repeater's range and weapon proficiency.
Your attacks with this ammo deal fire damage instead of piercing.
Your attacks with this ammo deal cold damage instead of piercing.
Your attacks with this ammo deal lightning damage instead of piercing.
Your attacks with this ammo deal acid damage instead of piercing.
Your attacks with this ammo deal radiant damage instead of piercing.
Your attacks with this ammo deal necrotic damage instead of piercing.
Your normal attack range is equal to your maximum attack range while using this ammo.

This ammo passes through each creature in a line equal to your normal attack range. The damage it deals is split evenly between each creature that would be hit by the attack roll made using this ammo.
Acts as a {@item tranq bomb|AGMH} with the bowgun's range and weapon proficiency.
You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls.
Instead of taking damage, a creature hit by this ammo regains 1d4 hit points.
This ammo deals no weapon damage, it instead explodes on a hit, dealing {@damage 2d6} fire damage to the target and each creature within 5 feet of the target.
You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls.

A creature hit by this ammo must succeed a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the poison on a success.
When you hit a creature with this ammo and it is within half your normal bowgun range, the damage dealt to the target is split evenly between it and each creature adjacent to it.

A creature hit by this ammo must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw, is immune to ammo's paralysis effect for 24 hours.
You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls.
Instead of taking damage, a creature hit by this ammo regains 1d6 hit points.

You do not make an attack with this ammo, instead each creature in a 15-foot cone in front of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d12} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This ammo deals no damage, the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

A creature hit by this ammo must succeed a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute, the creature can use their action to attempt to break free (Escape DC equal to your Ammo save DC).
You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls.
This ammo deals no damage, instead when you hit a creature with this ammo, that creature gains a +2 bonus to its AC for 1 minute. Hitting a creature with armor ammo again refreshes the duration.

This ammo deals no damage, instead when you hit a creature with this ammo, that creature gains a +2 bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute. Hitting a creature with demon ammo again refreshes the duration.
This ammo deals no damage, if the target is below 50 hit points it falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake.

item.name: Antidote
entries: A {@condition poisoned} creature that drinks this vial of liquid, neutralizes the poison afflicting it. If more than one poison afflicts the creature, it neutralizes one at random.

item.name: Antidote Horn
entries: {@i (Replaces one of the hunter's trinkets)} This horn has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend a charge to give one creature that is within 60 feet of you advantage on saving throws against poisons for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs. The horn regains 1d4-1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the horn is destroyed.

item.name: Antiseptic Stone
entries: An unnatural crystal with enhanced antiseptic qualities. As an action you can crush the stone, to gain advantage on saving throws against diseases for 1 hour.

item.name: Armor Horn
entries: {@i (Replaces one of the hunter's trinkets)} This horn has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend a charge to cast the {@spell shield of faith} spell from it, but you must maintain concentration on the spell. The horn regains 1d4-1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the horn is destroyed.

item.name: BBQ Spit
entries: Just what you need to cook meat. A must-have item for any hungry hunter.

item.name: Bomb Casing
entries: A base material for making hand-thrown bombs.

item.name: Bounce Bomb
entries: Setting fire to a bounce bomb causes it to launch 100 feet into the air and explode. It explodes early if it impacts a creature or object before reaching its maximum height, dealing 3d6 fire damage to creatures within 10 feet of it. A successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw halves the damage.

item.name: Bug Net
entries: A durable net for catching bugs.

item.name: Carving Knife
entries: Allows the wielder to add their proficiency bonus to carve checks, if they are not already proficient with the {@skill survival} skill.

item.name: Catalyst
entries: Works with other materials to enhance their effects. Cannot be used by itself.

item.name: Cleanser
entries: As an action you can apply this clear, scentless liquid to your armor or clothing. Removing any ice, mud, or webbing on you.

item.name: Cool Drink
entries: This white, translucent, pearly syrup, smells of spearmint and alcohol. When you drink it, you suffer no harm from temperatures as warm as 120 degrees Fahrenheit (49 degrees celsius) for the next 24 hours.

item.name: Deodorant
entries: As an action, you can activate this item, releasing a puff of deodorizing smoke that removes all natural and unnatural odors from your body. Additionally, for 1 hour, creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks against you that rely on smell.

item.name: Disposable Earplugs
entries: Basic foam style earplug protection. You are {@condition deafened} and have advantage on saving throws against thunder damage while these earplugs are in use. Once removed, the earplugs dissolve.

item.name: Dung Bomb
entries: As an action, you can throw this bomb up to 40 feet, releasing a horrid stench on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the dung bomb as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the creature has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight and smell for 1 hour and disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration for 1 minute. If the target is a creature with an Intelligence score of 8 or lower, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or immediately use its reaction to move up to its speed away from you.

item.name: Field Horn
entries: {@i (Replaces one of the hunter's trinkets)} When you play this horn, each hostile creature within 60 feet of you must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature will do everything it can on its turn to move towards and attack you. Once you use this horn, roll a d20. On a 5 or less, the horn is destroyed.

item.name: Fishing Lure (Arrowana)
entries: When you succeed on a {@table fish|AGMH|fishing} skill check while using this lure, roll a 1d4. On a 1-2, you catch a burst arrowana; on a 3-4, you catch a bomb arrowana. If you roll a 1 on your fishing skill check, the line snaps and the lure is lost.

item.name: Fishing Lure (Popfish)
entries: When you succeed on a {@table fish|AGMH|fishing} skill check while using this lure, you catch a popfish instead of rolling on the fish resource table. If you roll a 1 on your fishing skill check, the line snaps and the lure is lost.

item.name: Fishing Lure (Sushifish)
entries: When you succeed on a {@table fish|AGMH|fishing} skill check while using this lure, you catch a sushifish instead of rolling on the fish resource table. If you roll a 1 on your fishing skill check, the line snaps and the lure is lost.

item.name: Fishing Lure (Pin Tuna)
entries: When you succeed on a {@table fish|AGMH|fishing} skill check while using this lure, you catch a pin tuna instead of rolling on the fish resource table. If you roll a 1 on your fishing skill check, the line snaps and the lure is lost.

item.name: Fishing Lure (Whetfish)
entries: When you succeed on a {@table fish|AGMH|fishing} skill check while using this lure, you catch a whetfish instead of rolling on the fish resource table. If you roll a 1 on your fishing skill check, the line snaps and the lure is lost.

item.name: Flash Bomb
entries: As an action, you can throw this bomb up to 40 feet, creating a blinding flash of light on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the flash bomb as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the creature is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature can end this effect early by succeeding on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw at the end of their turn.

item.name: Frozen Berry
entries: When you eat this berry, you gain resistance to fire damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Gunpowder (10 oz)
entries: A dangerous substance that explodes when struck or heated. Setting fire to an ounce of gunpowder causes it to flare for 1 round, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

item.name: Health Horn
entries: {@i (Replaces one of the hunter's trinkets)} You can play a soothing tune with this horn when you take a short rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points at the end of the short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d4 hit points.

item.name: Hot Drink
entries: Kept in a standard glass vial, with a closed lid on top. The liquid inside is sparkling and orange, smelling and tasting of burning red peppers. When you drink it, you can tolerate temperatures as low as −50 degrees Fahrenheit (-45 degrees celsius) without any additional protection for 24 hours. If you wear heavy clothes, you can tolerate temperatures as low as −100 degrees Fahrenheit (-73 degrees celsius).

item.name: Immunizer
entries: A creature that drinks this vial of opaque liquid, gains advantage on saving throws against diseases for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

item.name: Lg Barrel-bomb
entries: Setting fire to a lg barrel-bomb causes it to explode, dealing 7d6 fire damage to creatures within 10 feet of it. A successful DC 15 Dexterity saving throw halves the damage.

item.name: Meat (Chilled)
entries: When you eat this meat, you suffer no harm from temperatures as warm as 120 degrees Fahrenheit (49 degrees celsius) for the next 24 hours.

item.name: Meat (Drugged)
entries: A creature that eats this meat must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 5 minutes. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

item.name: Meat (Hot)
entries: When you eat this meat, you can tolerate temperatures as low as −50 degrees Fahrenheit (-45 degrees celsius) without any additional protection for 24 hours. If you wear heavy clothes, you can tolerate temperatures as low as −100 degrees Fahrenheit (-73 degrees celsius).

item.name: Meat (Poisoned)
entries: A creature that eats this meat must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 6 (1d12) poison damage and is {@condition Poisoned} for 24 hours. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't Poisoned.

item.name: Meat (Tainted)
entries: A creature that eats this meat must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition Poisoned} for 1 minute. The Poisoned creature is {@condition Paralyzed}. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

item.name: Mega Nutrients
entries: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid increases its hit point maximum by 10 and it gains the same number of hit points. This benefit lasts for 8 hour.

item.name: Nutrients
entries: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid increases its hit point maximum by 5 and it gains the same number of hit points. This benefit lasts for 8 hour.

item.name: Oxygen Supply
entries: A bulb filled with Oxygen. Provides 10 minutes of breathable air.

item.name: Paintball
entries: When you throw this item at a creature, make a ranged weapon attack. On a hit, the creature is marked for 1 hour. While marked you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find it.

item.name: Pitfall Trap
entries: As an action, you place down a 2-foot wide circular pressure plate in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. The trap activates when more than 20 pounds of weight is placed on the pressure plate, causing the ground in a 10-foot-cubed area below the pressure plate to vanish and causing the Huge or smaller creature or object to spill into the newly formed pit. If the target is a creature, they must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or also be {@condition restrained} by the nets released from the pressure plate. A restrained creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, destroying the net on a successful save.

item.name: Pitfall Trap+
entries: Same as a {@item pitfall trap|AGMH}, but the save DC is increased to 18.

item.name: Poison Smoke Bomb
entries: As an action, a character can throw a smoke bomb at a point up to 40 feet away. One round after a smoke bomb lands, it emits a cloud of poisonous smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 20-foot radius. A creature that starts its turn in the smoke must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

item.name: Shock Trap
entries: As an action, you place down an electrical trap that covers a 10-foot-square area on the ground. The trap activates when a Large or bigger creature or object enters the traps area, sending an electric current through it. The creature or object must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated}, and have its movement speed reduced to 0 for 1 minute. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Shock Trap+
entries: Same as a {@item shock trap|AGMH}, but the save DC is increased to 18.

item.name: Sm Barrel-bomb
entries: Setting fire to a sm barrel-bomb causes it to explode, dealing 3d6 fire damage to creatures within 10 feet of it. A successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw halves the damage.

item.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: As an action, a character can throw a smoke bomb at a point up to 40 feet away. One round after a smoke bomb lands, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 20-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

item.name: Sonic Bomb
entries: As an action, you can throw this bomb up to 40 feet, creating an ear piercing sound on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the sonic bomb as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the creature is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A creature can end this effect early by succeeding on a DC 13 constitution saving throw at the end of their turn.

item.name: Tranq Bomb
entries: As an action, you can throw this bomb up to 40 feet, releasing a tranquilizing gas on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the tranq bomb as an improvised weapon. On a hit, roll 5d8. If the target is below one-fourth of its maximum hit points and its remaining hits points are below the number rolled, it falls {@condition unconscious} for 24 hours.

You can hit a creature with up to three tranq bombs or {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|ammo}. Adding the total of each tranq bomb or ammo together. If the creature does not fall unconscious after a third tranq bomb or ammo, it becomes immune to their effect for 24 hours.
A creature that does not have a capture loot table, is immune to tranq bombs or ammo effect.

item.name: Trap Tool
entries: A must-have item for putting together Pitfall Traps and other kinds of traps.

item.name: Well-done Steak
entries: When you eat this steak, it acts as a 1 days ration and provides a +1 bonus to any one skill of your choice for the next 8 hours.

item.name: Adamant Pill
entries: You gain +2 AC for the next 10 minutes. Taking more than one adamant pill at a time does not increase your AC beyond the +2 bonus it already provides, it instead increases the duration.

item.name: Air Philter
entries: When you drink this potion you can breathe normally in any environment for 1 hour, and you have advantage on saving throws made against harmful gases and vapors (such as {@spell cloudkill} and {@spell stinking cloud} effects, inhaled poisons, and the breath weapons of some dragons).

item.name: Ancient Potion
entries: When you drink this potion, you regain 8d4+8 hit points. It also removes any {@condition exhaustion} you are suffering from.

item.name: Armorskin
entries: Your AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier for the next 8 hours.

item.name: Dash Juice
entries: This potion is in a conical smooth glass bottle. It has a yellow color and fizzing bubbles. When you drink this potion, your speed increases by 10 feet for 1 hour.

item.name: Demondrug
entries: When you drink this potion, your Strength score increases by +2 for 1 hour.

item.name: Dust of Life
entries: When used, you and the 7 closest creatures within 10 feet of you heal for 1d6+2 hit points.

item.name: Energy Drink
entries: When you drink this vial, you reduce your {@condition exhaustion} level by one.

item.name: Herbal Medicine
entries: When you drink this vial of liquid, you gain advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour and you heal for 1d4 hit points. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

item.name: Lifepowder
entries: When used, you and the 7 closest creatures within 10 feet of you heal for 1d4+2 hit points.

item.name: Max Potion
entries: When you drink this pale yellow potion, it removes all effects that are reducing your hit point maximum and you regain 70 hit points.

item.name: Mega Air Philter
entries: When you drink this potion you can breathe normally in any environment for 24 hours, and you have advantage on saving throws made against harmful gases and vapors (such as {@spell cloudkill} and {@spell stinking cloud} effects, inhaled poisons, and the breath weapons of some dragons).

item.name: Mega Dash Juice
entries: This potion is in a small crystal vial embossed with a winged boot. The yellow liquid inside spins at a high rate of speed, even when left alone on a shelf. When you drink this potion, your speed increases by 20 feet for 1 hour.

item.name: Mega Demondrug
entries: When you drink this potion, your Strength score increases by +4 for 1 hour.

item.name: Mega Armorskin
entries: Your AC becomes 15 + your Dexterity modifier for the next 8 hours.

item.name: Might Pill
entries: When you swallow this pill, your Strength score increases by +4 for 1 minute. Once the effect wears off you gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. This bonus does not stack with any other effect that increases your Strength score.

item.name: Power Juice
entries: You gain the benefits of the {@spell haste} spell for 1 minute or until your Concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

item.name: Psychoserum
entries: This potion temporarily sharpens your sixth sense and attunes you to the ways of monsters. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks when tracking a creature for 24 hours.

entries.name: Loading
entries: As a bonus action you switch the ammo your bowgun is using with another. {@i This replaces the standard 5e loading property}.

itemType.name: Hunter Weapon
entries: {@b {@i Hunter Weapon.}} As a hunter weapon increases in rarity, it gains new features, as can be seen on that weapon's table. Rarer weapons have access to features from all lower rarities.
{@b {@i Slots.}} Each rarity has a number of slots the hunter can place materials into, enhancing their weapon with magical effects.
{@b {@i Bonus.}} You gain a certain bonus to attacks and damage rolls while wielding hunter weapons of a given rarity.

itemType.name: Phial (Switch Axe)
entries: {@b {@i Phial.}} {@optfeature Phials|AGMH} are a special kind of item that can only be used to grant phial effects when inserted into a {@item switch axe|AGMH} of a certain rarity or higher. Some phials have upgraded effects only available with axes of even higher rarities.
As part of a short or long rest you can insert a phial into this weapon's {@optfeature sword gauge|AGMH}...

When you attack with this weapon in sword mode (before or after you make the roll, but before you know the result), you can expend a number of charges equal to the phials cost from the sword gauge to use the phials effect on this attack.

itemType.name: Coating (Bow)
entries: {@b {@i Coating.}} A coating is a special item that can only be used in conjunction with a {@item bow|AGMH} of a certain rarity or higher.
As a bonus action, you can coat up to 10 arrows in a special oil to add an effect to your arrows. The oil lasts for 10 minutes before evaporating.
{@b GM's Note}
Characters are not supposed to have an infinite amount of coatings or ammunition available to them, they should be bought at a price that the GM sees fit.

A flask of coating weighs the same as a {@item oil (flask)|PHB|flask of oil} by default, and a holster of ammunition weighs the same as a {@item ball bearings (bag of 1,000)|PHB|bag of ball bearings}.
The GM should determine how much coating or ammunition of each type a character has. Generally speaking a character should not have more than a dozen flasks of a coating, or holsters of ammunition.

itemType.name: Ammo (Bowgun)
entries: {@b {@i Ammo.}} Ammo can only be fired from a {@item light bowgun|AGMH|light} or {@item heavy bowgun|AGMH|heavy} bowgun of a certain rarity or higher.
All ammo deal normal weapon damage unless otherwise specified. Some of your ammo require your target to make a saving throw to resist the ammo's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

itemType.name: Ammo (Repeaters)
entries: {@b {@i Ammo.}} Ammo can only be fired from {@item dual repeaters|AGMH} of a certain rarity or higher.
All ammo deal normal weapon damage unless otherwise specified. Some of your ammo require your target to make a saving throw to resist the ammo's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

trait.name: Leech
entries: If a khezu whelp hit with a bite attack, it can then use its bonus action to attach itself to a creature (escape {@dc 10}). At the start of the khezu whelp's turn it deals 5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage and regains hit points equal to that amount.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the lightning damage taken, and the khezu whelp regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Poison Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

Khezu are large, pale Wyverns with a flabby, rubbery hide which they constantly keep damp, similar to that of an amphibian. Many of their blood vessels and veins can be seen through their pale skin. Their tail features a specialized orifice which bonds to the ground during electrical attacks and helps them cling onto cave ceilings. Their mouth features rows of sharp teeth. Khezu feet lack claws, and instead have suction pad-like toes to assist them in climbing and hanging from cave walls and ceilings. Spending most of their lives in the dark, their eyes have regressed greatly, though they make up for this with a superb sense of smell. A layer of fat helps to keep them warm and prolong the time they can spend hunting for food. Khezu have an extendable neck which allows them to grasp and ambush prey from afar, such as from a cave ceiling. Khezu are hermaphrodites, which means an individual is both male and female. To reproduce they paralyze a creature and inject their young, known as Whelps. The Whelps grow inside their victim until it dies, or when they are strong enough to leave.

Although Khezu are cave dwellers, they go out when they please, or when food inside grows too scarce. While Khezu outside a cave are vulnerable to larger Wyverns like Tigrex, inside caves Khezu have the advantage. In addition to being unhampered by the dark, they can cling to the ceiling and attack from above.

A Khezu's habitat is often located near active sources of water; some sources claim this is because the water is excellent for conducting electricity into their prey, while others speculate that Khezu may need the dampness for their moist skin. Such areas include swamps and oceanside caves.

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: The EHW can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The EHW is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The EHW's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The EHW makes three attacks with its greatsword or its heavy bowgun.

action.name: Heavy Bowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage of the type the EHW choses between: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, radiant, necrotic.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage of the type the EHW choses between: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, radiant, necrotic.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The EHW adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the EHW must see the attacker wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Immunity (3/long rest)
entries: When the EHW is subject to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, radiant, or necrotic damage, it can use its reaction to gain immunity to that damage type for 10 minutes.

fluff.name: Equal Hunter Weapon Generation 2
entries: The equal hunter weapons, or "EHW" for short, were meant as a replacement for hunters during the time of the ancient civilization. The first to be created were basic, only capable of collecting herbs, gathering mushrooms, and if lucky they were able to kill a bulldrome without being completely destroyed. They were closer to robots than the final generations of EHW's that fought in the Great Dragon War.

The second generation of EHWs were still constructs like their predecessors before, but they were far more advanced. Their armor was made of rare ores like machalite or dragonite. They were able to wield the same weapons the hunters could use, but with more power and accuracy. The second generation were the first to surpass basic hunters, but they still remained mindless. For the ancient civilization they were perfect for gathering basic materials from some of the tougher creatures like the rathian or rathalos without the risk of losing the life of one of their hunters. Once given a task this generation of EHWs pursued their goal, only returning once it was completed and never letting anything stand in their way.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The equal dragon weapon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Dragon Slayer
entries: When the equal dragon weapon hits a dragon with its melee weapon attacks, the dragon takes an extra 3d6 force damage.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The equal dragon weapon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the equal dragon weapon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless it wishes to be affected, the equal dragon weapon is immune to spells of 4th level or lower. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The equal dragon weapon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The equal dragon weapon deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The equal dragon weapon can use its frightful presence. It then makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the force damage taken, and the equal dragon weapon regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). If the Target is Large or smaller the target is {@condition restrained}, until this grapple ends. The equal dragon weapon has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and the target must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the equal dragon weapon's choice that is within 240 feet of the equal dragon weapon and aware of him must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the equal dragon weapon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Dragon's Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The equal dragon weapon exhales an element of its choice between cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or poison in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw, taking 77 ({@damage 22d6}) damage of the chosen element and be afflicted with dragonblight for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not afflicted with dragonblight on a successful one. A creature afflicted with dragonblight can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.
Choose 5 legendary actions from the following list.

items.name: Detect
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) Check.

items.name: Mucus Ball
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon launches a ball of mucus at a target. The target must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained} by the mucus (escape 20).

items.name: Poisoned Tail
items.entry: Choose a creature within 25 feet of the equal dragon weapon. That creature must make a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Release Pheromones
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon releases a cloud of pheromones in a 120 foot sphere around it. The cloud remains until the end of the equal dragon weapon next turn. Each creature in the area, except for the equal dragon weapon, has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration while in the cloud.

items.name: Tail Attack
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon makes one tail attack.

items.name: Devil's Powder (Costs 2 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon beats its wings releasing an explosive powder and creating a spark with its teeth. Each creature within 20 feet of the equal dragon weapon must succeed on a {dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) force damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the equal dragon weapon's gaze for the next 24 hours.

items.name: Quake (Costs 2 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon strikes the ground with its maul like tail, triggering a tremor. All creatures on the ground within 60 feet of the equal dragon weapon must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Shake Off (Costs 2 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon thrashes around in an attempt to throw any object or creature that is on its body. Each creature on the equal dragon weapon must make a {@dc 28} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (creature's choice), or be thrown off the equal dragon weapon, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fall damage upon hitting the ground.

items.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions).
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon moves up to its speed. During this move it can move through the spaces of other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creature the equal dragon weapon moves through must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or takes 24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Water Jet - Line (Costs 2 Actions).
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon discharges a beam of high pressurized water from its mouth or tail in a 1200-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in a line must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions).
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the equal dragon weapon must succeed on a {@dc 28} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The equal dragon weapon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

items.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: Each living creature within 20 feet of the equal dragon weapon must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Frost Armor (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon coats itself in a layer of frost and ice for 1 minute, until it takes 40 fire damage from a spell or until takes 60 damage from any other single attack. While coated in this way, the equal dragon weapon has +3 bonus to its AC.

items.name: Hail Storm (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon forms five boulder-sized chunks of ice from the water in the air that plummet to the ground at different points within 90 feet of it. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on each point, must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 9 ({damage 2d8}) cold damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one ice chunk is affected only once.

items.name: Blue Meteor (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon opens its mouth and creates three swirling balls of blue fire, launching them into the sky, each of which can strike a different target the equal dragon weapon can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Piercing Roar (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon lets out an ear shattering roar. Each creature that is within 20 feet of the equal dragon weapon must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Whirlwind (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon chooses 3 unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of it. An elemental force that resembles a dust devil appears in the cubes and they move in a straight line 120 feet away from the equal dragon weapon before dispersing. Each creature in one of the lines must make a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) force damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

object.name: Dragonator

immune.special: All damage that isn't siege damage

entries: A Dragonator is any powered melee system that deploys massive spikes used to damage monsters. They are regularly installed in strategic locations to help in battle with large monsters. Dragonators consist of at least three pieces: the machinery, the weapon, and the control unit. Little is known about the machinery, other than the fact that it uses pressurized steam to launch the weapon. The steam is provided by a coal-fed fire.

The weapon itself consists of two massive rod-like objects, which are separated by 5 feet of space between them, and propelled by the steam at high velocities outward striking any creature in a 15 foot line in front of them. A Huge or larger creature can be hit by both dragonators, while a Large or smaller creature can only be hit by one.

The weapon can be as simple as iron spears (3d6 piercing damage), or as complex as spiky, spinning drills (10d10) piercing damage. There can be multiple rods launched from each Dragonator. The dragonnator only requires the switch or lever to be used to activate the dragonator.

attackEntries: {@hit +12} to hit, reach 15 ft., all creatures in a straight line within its reach.
hitEntries: the creature takes damage determined by the type of dragonator. {@i Miss:} Creature takes half as much damage.

object.name: Dragonrazer

immune.special: All damage that isn't siege damage

entries: A Dragonrazer is a large cannon that uses dragonrazer fuel cells to propel a large explosive harpoon through the air at destructive speeds.

A dragonrazer is supported on a large swiveling metal platform. Before it can be fired, the dragonrazer must be loaded with two fuel cells (75 lbs each) and aimed. It takes one action to load each full cell, one action to aim it, and one action to fire it.

attackEntries: {@hit +8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target.
hitEntries: 27 ({@damage 5d10}) piercing damage and explodes. {@i Miss:} The harpoon lands 1d8 spaces away from the target in a random direction and then explodes. A creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere of the harpoon when it explodes must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

object.name: Large Boulder
entries: A large boulder might be hanging from a large group of vines far overhead, or a chunk of the mountain side. In an arena, the boulder might be held above the arena floor by ropes and pulleys. The boulder doesn't necessarily have to be a boulder, it could be an ancient tree trunk or part of a building that comes toppling down.
The boulder can be knocked loose by attacking it, by a lever, or some other way to release it as a trap.

Any creature under the boulder when it hits the ground must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, is not knocked prone, and is pushed into an unoccupied space adjacent to the boulder.

optionalfeature.name: Accelerator Gauge
entries: When you hit with this weapon, you gain 1 charge up to a maximum of 5. You lose all charges, if you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or don't hit a target within 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Detonation Velocity
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend any number of {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to increase your weapon's damage by +1 for each charge expended.

optionalfeature.name: Accel Jump
entries: When you jump, you can expend {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to increase your jump's height or distance by an extra 5 feet for each charge expended. If the weapon is very rare or higher, the distance or height is increased by an additional 5 feet per charge.

optionalfeature.name: Burst Slash
entries: As an action you can expend up to 5 {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to unleash an accelerated slash against a creature within 5 feet of you. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Strength Modifier. On a failed save, the target takes #d4 slashing damage, where # is equal to the number of charges expended. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.
This damage is increased to #d6 at rare, #d8 at very rare, and #d10 at legendary.

optionalfeature.name: Dash Burst
entries: As a bonus action you can expend 1 {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charge} to dash up to half of your movement speed. You can expend extra charges to move an additional 10 feet for each additional charge you expend.

optionalfeature.name: Evade Slash
entries: When you hit a hostile creature with this weapon, you can expend 3 {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to move up to 15 feet in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Heat Gauge
entries: When you use one of this weapon's properties that expends {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charge(s)}, you gain 1 heat up to a maximum of 3.

optionalfeature.name: Full Accel Mode
entries: As a bonus action you can expend 3 {@optfeature Heat Gauge|AGMH|heat} to enter full accel mode. Until the end of your next turn this weapon's reach increases to 10 feet, it deals an extra 1d6 slashing damage, and your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Blast Evade
entries: When you are subject to the effect of an area-of-effect attack, spell, or spell-like ability; you can use your reaction to expend a number of {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to try and move yourself out of the area. For each charge you expend, you can move 5 feet in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. If you leave the area-of-effect's area, you are no longer considered a target of it.

optionalfeature.name: Hyper Burst Slash
entries: While you are in {@optfeature full accel mode|AGMH}, your {@optfeature burst slash|AGMH} damage is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Mid-Air Dash Slash
entries: {@i 2/turn}
When hit you a creature with an attack while in the air, you can expend a {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charge} to move up to 10 feet in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Switch Mode (CB)
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch the weapon between its axe or sword and shield mode.

items: {@b Axe Mode} {@i 1d12 slashing, 7 lb, heavy, two-handed}
{@b Sword & Shield Mode} {@i 1d6 slashing, +2 AC, 8 lb, finesse, light}

optionalfeature.name: Phial Charge
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapons sword and shield {@optfeature switch mode (cb)|AGMH|mode}, it gains 1 phial charge up to a maximum of 5. The charges last until your next short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Guard
entries: {@b Sword}

As a reaction, when you are hit by an attack you can expend 1 {@optfeature phial charge|AGMH|phial} to deal {@damage 1d4} damage to the creature, this damage is done as your choice of acid, cold, fire, or lightning.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Discharge
entries: {@b Axe}

As a bonus action upon hitting a creature, you can expend 1 {@optfeature phial charge|AGMH|phial} to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage to the target, this damage is done as your choice of acid, cold, fire, or lightning.
This damage is increased to 1d8 at very rare and 1d10 at legendary.

optionalfeature.name: Amped Element Discharge
entries: As an action you can expend any number of {@optfeature phial charge|AGMH}s and release a shockwave of acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice) in a 15-foot cone in front of you. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Strength modifier taking #d4 of your chosen damage type, where # is the number of phials you have expended on a failed save. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
This damage is increased to #d6 at very rare and #d8 at legendary.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Guard Upgrade
entries: Your {@optfeature elemental guard|AGMH} now deals {@damage 1d6} acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Discharge Upgrade I
entries: Your {@optfeature elemental discharge|AGMH} now deals {@damage 1d8} acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Amped Element Discharge Upgrade I
entries: Your {@optfeature amped element discharge|AGMH} now deals #d6 acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Discharge Upgrade II
entries: Your {@optfeature elemental discharge|AGMH} now deals {@damage 1d10} acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Amped Element Discharge Upgrade II
entries: Your {@optfeature amped element discharge|AGMH} now deals #d8 acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice). Additionally you double the damage against a Huge or larger creature if the entire 15-foot cone is its space.

optionalfeature.name: Demon Mode
entries: {@b 2/long rest}

As a bonus action your body is enveloped in a demonic aura for 30 seconds or until you are knocked {@condition prone}. While Demon mode is active, you gain +5 movement speed, and deal an extra {@damage 1d4} weapon damage on the first attack that hits each turn. Once demon mode ends you cannot use it again for 30 seconds.

optionalfeature.name: Demon Mode Upgrade
entries: You can use {@optfeature demon mode|AGMH} one extra time (3 total) between long rests, its movement speed bonus increases to 10 feet, and you now deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage on all weapon attacks while demon mode is active.

optionalfeature.name: Inflict
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon where they make a saving throw against a condition causing effect, the save DC is increased by 1.

Condition causing effects can include spells and abilities such as the Ranger's {@spell ensnaring strike}, some of the Battlemaster's {@filter combat maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B}, or any magical condition inflicting effect the GM may put on this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Archdemon Mode
entries: You can use {@optfeature demon mode|AGMH} one extra time (4 total) between long rests and its movement speed bonus increases to 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Inflict Upgrade I
entries: Your save DC for {@optfeature inflict|AGMH|condition causing effects} by this weapon is now increased by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Archdemon Mode Upgrade
entries: You can use {@optfeature demon mode|AGMH} one extra time (5 total) between long rests, its movement speed bonus increases to 20 feet, and you now deal an extra {@damage 1d6} weapon damage while demon mode is active.

optionalfeature.name: Inflict Upgrade II
entries: Your save DC for {@optfeature inflict|AGMH|condition causing effects} by this weapon is now increased by 3.

optionalfeature.name: Charged Slash
entries: As part of the {@action Attack} action or when you make an opportunity attack you can forgo an attack with this weapon in order to grant the weapon 1 charge (3 max). Charges are lost if not used within 1 minute.

When you make an attack roll while the weapon has any charges, all charges are expended and that attack is made with advantage; you can forgo this advantage and all other advantages you gain on this turn to gain 1 extra charge to expend on this attack.

On hit the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier as weapon damage + the weapon's extra damage material (if it has one) for each charge expended in this way, plus an extra 3 damage if you expended 2 charges, or 6 damage if you expended 3 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Guard (GS)
entries: As a reaction, you add 2 AC against one melee attack that would hit you. To do so, you must see the attacker and be wielding the greatsword. You have disadvantage on attacks until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Charged Slash Upgrade I
entries: Your {@optfeature charged slash|AGMH|charge slash} now deals an extra {@damage 1d8} + your Strength modifier as weapon damage + the weapon's extra damage material (if it has one) for each charge expended in this way, plus an extra 3 damage if you expended 2 charges, or 6 damage if you expended 3 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Guard Upgrade I (GS)
entries: You now gain a +3 bonus to your AC when you use {@optfeature guard|AGMH|this reaction}.

optionalfeature.name: Charged Slash Upgrade II
entries: Your {@optfeature charged slash|AGMH|charge slash} now deals an extra {@damage 1d10} + your Strength modifier as weapon damage + the weapon's extra damage material (if it has one) for each charge expended in this way, plus an extra 3 damage if you expended 2 charges, or 6 damage if you expended 3 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Guard Upgrade II (GS)
entries: You now gain a +4 bonus to your AC when you use {@optfeature guard|AGMH|this reaction}.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Draw
entries: When you draw or pickup this weapon you can don your shield as part of the same interaction.

optionalfeature.name: Shells
entries: Your gunlance holds up to three shells. As an action you can expend a shell to make a melee or ranged weapon attack against a target. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, this attack replaces one of them. This attack has an reach of 10-feet or a range of 80/320, dealing {@damage 1d8} fire damage. You can reload one expended shell as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Guard Reload
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee weapon attack while you are holding your shield, you reload one expended {@optfeature shells|AGMH|shell}.

optionalfeature.name: Shells Upgrade I
entries: Your gunlance can now hold up to four {@optfeature shells|AGMH}.

optionalfeature.name: Wyvernfire
entries: As a bonus action, you can load a special shell into the gunlance and use your action to release flames in a 30-foot long line that is 5-feet wide.
